metadata.name: Security Privileges Enumeration Via Whoami.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\whoami.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('whoami.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' /priv')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -priv'))))

output.summary: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.
